item.title: Clash Royale Creator Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Clash Royale is one of the most popular mobile games in the world, and thousands of players play it every day, each trying to become the best. Many gamers often check resources, such as YouTubers or streamers, to understand their strategy or even copy their deck to be as good in battles. Once you have gained experience and a working strategy after watching the video, you can support your favorite player by redeeming Clash Royale creator codes. This way, after each purchase, the chosen creator will receive a piece of the profits, so it's a great way to thank those who helped you.

Updated October 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are a variety of creator codes available, each offering different in-game rewards. These codes can provide useful bonuses as you play, and they cover a wide range of creators. Keeping track of them ensures you don’t miss out on any benefits. This guide is updated regularly, so checking back later may reveal additional options.

Clash Royale: All Creator Codes

The number of creators is growing every day, as is their fanbase. At the moment, there are already many creators in the game whose code you can redeem to support them. Below are all the current creators codes, so you can choose the one you deem your favorite.

The creator's nickname is on the left, and the code is on the right.

Clash Royale: How to Redeem Creator Codes

Redeeming Creator Codes in Clash Royale is not difficult and will take you a few clicks. If you haven't done it before, here are the detailed instructions:

  • Go to the in-game store.
  • Scroll down until you see the Creator Boost section.
  • There will be a green Enter Code button in the Creator Boost section. Click on it.
  • After doing so, you will open a new menu with an input field and an OK button.
  • Now enter one of the above Creator Codes in the input field.
  • Click the OK button to confirm your choice.

It is worth noting that by redeeming the code, you will not support one creator forever. You can change to another at any time.

item.title: Roblox: Adopt Me! Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Jump Links

  • Adopt Me! Codes
  • How To Redeem Codes In Adopt Me!
  • How to Play Adopt Me!
  • The Best Roblox Town and City Games Like Adopt Me!
  • About the Adopt Me! Developers

If Roblox players enjoy caring for and raising pets and children, as well as customizing their character, then they'll almost certainly love Adopt Me! The purpose of this article is to provide players will all of the latest Adopt Me! codes. Redeeming them will give players a good boost, especially in the early stages of the game.

Updated October 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are currently no active codes available for Adopt Me! right now. However, new rewards are often added during special updates or events. Keep an eye on official announcements and revisit this page later to see when fresh codes become available.

Listed below are all the active and expired codes for Adopt Me!, as well as how to redeem them. At the time of writing, however, there are no active codes for Adopt Me!, and there's no way to redeem codes at the moment.

Adopt Me! Codes

Codes Checked on October 18, 2025.

All Active Adopt Me! Codes

  • No active codes.

All Expired Adopt Me! Codes

  • 40BILLION : 2x Multiplier
  • AMTRUCK2024 : Canine Cruiser
  • 2xROSS : 4hrs of 2x Bucks & Aging
  • SUMMERBREAK : 70 Bucks
  • SUMMERSALE : 70 Bucks
  • 1B1LL1ONV1S1TS : 200 Bucks
  • M0N3YTR33S : 200 Bucks
  • GIFTUNWRAP : 200 Bucks
  • DiscordFTW : 70 Bucks
  • subbethink : 100 Bucks
  • GIFTUNWRAP : 200 Bucks
  • SEAcreatures : unknown item

How To Redeem Codes In Adopt Me!

When it comes to redeeming codes in Adopt Me!, there are a few simple steps to follow that will be listed below. If, for some reason, a code does not work, be sure to check to see if the code has been entered correctly. If the code still doesn't work, it means that it has recently expired or has already been redeemed.

  1. Launch Adopt Me!
  2. Once you are in the game world, you need to exit the area of houses.
  3. Then go to the Trade Tower. To make it easier for you to find it, we have attached a screenshot above.
  4. Go inside and head towards Agent Ruhi.
  5. There will be a building right next to him. Go to it and press E.
  6. Copy a code into the code box and press enter

With the holiday season in full effect and the new year festivities around the corner, players should be sure to continue looking out for the latest news and updates regarding Adopt Me!

How to Play Adopt Me!

It is impossible to say precisely how to play Adopt Me! as it is an open world Role Play game. In other words, it's a life simulator where players can grow a child, take care of a pet, have fun in a big city, dress up their character, and just do whatever they want.

The Best Roblox Town and City Games Like Adopt Me!

Adopt Me! is a fun game, but it can get boring after a while. Players may also want to try something new. In this article below, players can find the top 5 games like Adopt Me!. All of them impress with their quality and provide a great gaming experience.

  • Berry Avenue
  • Brookhaven
  • Jailbreak
  • Ohio
  • Da Hood

About the Adopt Me! Developers

Adopt Me! is an exciting game created by Uplift Games. Their Roblox group already has more than 10M members, which is really impressive.

Roblox - Game
13
8.4 /10
Released
September 1, 2006

item.title: Best Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Jump Links

  • All Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID Codes
  • How to Use Blue Lock Rivals Sound IDs
  • How to Get More Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID Codes

Blue Lock Rivals is a soccer game on Roblox with a huge active user base. This is not surprising, as the developers are constantly working to improve gameplay and add new content.

One of the game's great features is the ability to add custom sounds for goals and other actions. If you want to diversify the gameplay, you should use the Blue Lock Rivals sound ID codes from our guide.

Updated October 19, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Several new sound IDs have just been added to Blue Lock Rivals , giving you more options to customize your sounds. The latest additions bring fresh energy to the game, mixing humor, chaos, and signature moments from the series. You can equip them to make your gameplay stand out even more. Stay tuned for future updates, as more exclusive sounds could be introduced soon.

How to Use Blue Lock Rivals Sound IDs

Sound IDs in Blue Lock Rivals are straightforward to use, but there is one inconvenient detail that may be concerning for many players. To apply custom sounds, you must purchase a game pass for 109 Robux. However, this is a small price to pay, so it's worth buying if you're a fan of this Roblox game. To help you, we've created a step-by-step guide explaining how to redeem codes in Blue Lock Rivals .

  • Launch Roblox and open Blue Lock Rivals .
  • Look at the bottom of the screen with a bunch of buttons. You need to click on the rightmost button, Settings.
  • Next, you will see three text fields. Enter the code in one of them, depending on your preference. Then click Set.
  • If you don't have a game pass yet, buy it. After that, you will be able to use different sound IDs during the game.

How to Get More Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID Codes

Blue Lock Rivals Sound ID codes can be found all over the internet, for example, on TikTok or in guides like this one. We cannot recommend a specific source for the sounds as there are so many of them, so we recommend bookmarking this page in your browser, as we will be updating it with new cool sounds from time to time.

item.title: Obsidian Announces Special Fallout: New Vegas Stream
item.description:
Obsidian Entertainment will be participating in a special Fallout: New Vegas panel taking place as part of Fallout Fan Celebration 2025, the company has announced. While the annual event has not consistently received major support from the Fallout: New Vegas developer in the past, this year appears to be an exception.

Today, October 19, marks the 15th anniversary of Fallout: New Vegas releasing for PC and the seventh console generation. To date, New Vegas is still the only Fallout game developed by Obsidian Entertainment.

New Vegas Devs Are Coming to Fallout Fan Celebration 2025

Commemorating the game's latest anniversary, Obsidian announced it will host a special retrospective panel with several Fallout: New Vegas developers as part of the latest iteration of Fallout Fan Celebration. The 2025 event will take place on November 15, beginning at 10am PT / 1pm ET. The studio has not yet identified the staffers it will be sending to speak at the event, but it did reveal there will be four of them.

Separately, Fallout Fan Celebration 2025 organizers confirmed that the November 15 panel will be live-streamed. The current plan is to broadcast all events taking place during the Nevada convention, though livestream details have yet to be announced, as the organizers are still in the process of finalizing the logistics. The November 15 panel with Obsidian staffers is described as "a trip down memory lane in the Mojave Wasteland." The real-life event will take place at the Pioneer Saloon in Goodsprings, one of the many locations that Fallout: New Vegas recreated.

Fallout Fan Celebration 2025 will run from November 14 through 16. Obsidian support aside, this is an unofficial convention, meaning it is not expected to yield any big news concerning upcoming video game projects. Such announcements would be more likely to materialize during this year's Fallout Day broadcast—scheduled for October 23—though that's not to say that they will.

An internal presentation leaked during Microsoft’s legal battle with the FTC over the Activision Blizzard acquisition previously revealed that Bethesda had been planning a Fallout 3 remaster in the early 2020s. The documents made no mention of New Vegas receiving similar treatment. Even the Fallout 3 remaster is still far from completion as of late 2025, according to serial leaker Nate the Hate, who recently said he does not expect the project to be announced during the October 23 Fallout Day broadcast.

22
8.9 /10
8 /10

Fallout: New Vegas

item.title: Say Goodbye to Mega Steelix and Scizor in Pokemon Legends: Z-A
item.description:
Pokemon Legends: Z-A has come out just a few days ago, and it has already divided the fanbase with some polarizing new features and the lack of traditional ones, or even because of its sometimes buggy or poor gameplay experience. With Pokemon Legends: Z-A being review-bombed, it's no wonder that there are some unhappy fans, be it due to some shiny Pokemon being virtually uncatchable as they disappear or due to the game's lengthy tutorial. The game is clearly not for everyone, and it may upset yet another slice of the population when they find out that Mega Steelix and Scizor are almost unobtainable.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's new Mega Evolutions can be post-game rewards in some cases, like with Pyrorite and Malamarite only becoming purchasable for Mega Shards after beating the game and getting Mega Zygarde. While this doesn't make a lot of sense, things get worse for fans of some of the most popular Megas out there. Mega Steelix and Scizor have always been some of the most beloved Megas in the series, but Pokemon Legends: Z-A doesn't give them much love for a few reasons:

  • Scyther is only available in Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's Wild Zone 13, which is unlocked after Mission 14.
  • Onix is only available in Wild Zone 14, which is unlocked after Mission 19.
  • There is no Link Cable in the game, meaning that Scyther and Onix need to be traded while holding a Metal Coat to evolve.
  • Metal Coats are infinitely available in the post-game, but before that, players have to be Rank A (Mission 35) to unlock the side missions that award one each (Steadfast as Steel and A Feather from Skarmory).
  • In order to trade with other players, one has to pay for the Nintendo Switch Online subscription.
  • There are no reported instances of wild Steelix or Scizor so far in the game, meaning that they may be trade-only.
  • You can't transfer past versions of Steelix or Scizor to Pokemon Legends: Z-A .

For all these reasons, it's apparent that Mega Steelix and Scizor are not actually easily obtainable, and they may be some of the last Pokemon one gets - if at all. This is particularly bad considering how early Steelixite and Scizorite can be obtained.

Steelixite and Scizorite Mega Stones in Pokemon Legends: Z-A can be purchased at the Stone Emporium, which is immediately available.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Makes Getting Steelix and Scizor Unnecessarily Hard

Considering that a lot of the game's content is timegated behind completing story missions, it's no surprise that Onix and Scyther are not early catches, or that the Metal Coat is hard to get. However, it makes very little sense to have Steelixite and Scizorite available immediately at the Stone Emporium while Metal Coat is an end-game item, and trading is necessary to unlock Steelix and Scizor in the first place.

It's worth noting that one also needs Steelix and Scizor to complete Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Pokedex.

Shiny Mega Steelix and Scizor Are Virtually Impossible to Get in Pokemon Legends: Z-A

On top of that, shiny Pokemon in Pokemon Legends: Z-A can be trickier to trade, meaning that fans who want a shiny Mega Steelix or Scizor will have even more of a hard time getting them. This is because they need to find fellow players who have met all the necessary conditions to get Steelix and Scizor and have an NSO subscription, and they also need to be looking for a shiny evolution trade.

Granted, there are Pokemon Legends: Z-A trade codes now to simplify things, but with no chat and random people joining in on the trade, it's incredibly hard to find someone with the desire to trade a shiny Onix or Scyther with a Metal Coat. This is a very odd move for Game Freak, and it's unclear why Mega Steelix and Scizor in particular got the short end of the stick.

33
4.7 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A
